description: Conversion of existing bungalow into two self-contained residential units; single storey side and rear extension; (following demolition of existing garage and rear extension); rear roof extension and installation of three rooflights to front elevation incorporating roofspace accommodation; front infill extension and front porch extension; associated internal and external alterations; and provision of amenity space, cycle and car parking.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): P102-P2 (proposed ground floor and loft plan); P103-P2 (proposed roof plan side elevations); P104-P2 (proposed front & rear elevations); P701- P1 (proposed cross section)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D1, D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any subsequent amendment, revision or new Order) no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.

Reason:  To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan(2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019)
| The proposed rooflights hereby approved shall not project more than 150mm from the roof plane and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D4 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).
| No part of the flat roof of the development hereby approved shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A  and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013); London Plan(2021) policies D3 and D4

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (as amended), no extensions or works as specified in the stated classed shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Additionally, the residential units hereby approved shall at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order) without express planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: : To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D6 and of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to occupation of the development, an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedroom adjacent to staircase, living/dining room and kitchen above/below bedroom of separate dwellings shall be implemented and thereafter be permanently retained. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with policy D6 of the London Plan(2021); policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.

| Notwithstanding the information hereby approved, further details of the forecourt layout shall, to include  screened refuse storage, secure cycle parking and soft landscaping, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation of the development.  All detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the premises.

Any planting that is part of the approved scheme that within a period of five years after planting is removed, dies or becomes seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season and all planting shall be replaced with others of a similar size and species and in the same position, unless the Local Planning Authority first gives written consent to any variation. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening and to ensure that the off-street parking does not prejudice pedestrian safety and in the interests of providing a sustainable environment for future occupiers of the development in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Development Strategy 2026 (2012); policy D3 and D6 of the London Plan (2021); The London Environment Strategy (2018); and policies 5.10, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| One of the units hereby approved shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Building Regulations Part M4(3)(2)(b). Evidence demonstrating compliance should be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to occupation.
Reason: To ensure there is no net loss of adaptable homes capable of providing adequate amenity in accordance with policy D5 of the London Plan(2021)
| At least four (4) secure and covered cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T5 and table 10.2

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the front garden of the property, in accordance with BS5906:2005. It shall be fully implemented and made available for use and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021); policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
